result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hunter N Shields

records.addlTxt: Stephen Compton

Defendant Hunter N Shields in court.  Attorney Stephen M Compton in court for Hunter N Shields.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. #1 confirmed for trial. Parties stipulate to Defendant being on bond. New offer was just given. Atty Compton wishes not to recite the offer on record as of yet. Trial on 21CF100 is back to back with other cases. If Defendant wants to enter a change of plea that will need to be done by 11-9-22 @ 1:15 call. Jury Instructions to be filed by Noon on 11/11/22. in regards to 906.15 - Atty Compton is requesting. Jurors will be able to ask questions. 5 strikes, 1 alternate and seat 23 in the box.
DA's request for certified copies

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

3:00 PM (64-06) Defendant Hunter N Shields in court.  Attorney Steve Compton in court for and with Hunter Shields. Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions. 
Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
ADA Herrmann states the Information is not complete, although will be the same as the Complaint. 
Attorney Compton will accept ADA Herrmann's statement and will plea not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.

Adj. 3:05PM

*AMENDED 10/03/2022: BOND TO COVER NEW CHARGE 22GF1015 (22-4600)*

BOND TO COVER 22CF192, 21CF100, 21CT98, & 22CT160
MUST POST $500.00 CASH. (ALREADY POSTED)
MUST COMPLY WITH PRETRIAL SERVICES. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

J.J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Hunter Noah Shields in court, in custody by video with Attorney Compton. Case called at 1:18 PM. Discussion as to bond. Bond total all files. Minutes filed.
